SENT.plain: A cat was presented with severe progressive anemia despite marked erythroblastosis
The cat was negative for feline leukemia virus antigen and feline immunodeficiency virus antibody
Bone marrow cytology revealed an excess of erythroid cells with a predominance of prorubricytes and basophilic rubricytes
No response to immunosuppressive therapy was obtained, and a tentative diagnosis of myelodysplastic syndrome was made
The cat showed a partial response to low-dose cytarabine (20 mg/m(2) subcutaneously q24) but died 51 days after the 1st admission
Histopathological examination revealed fibrosis in the bone marrow and marked infiltration of erythroid cells into other organs
